Response:
What is it:

Now live is Service Hub Enterprise - a new package of service tools that helps sophisticated service teams. This new package includes everything thing found in Service Hub Pro, our new enterprise platform level features, and new tools like Goals (beta), Health Scoring(beta), and Playbooks (live).

Questions? Drop them in #askinbound18-launchqs on SlackWant to get a customer access to something in beta? Please fill out this form.Knowledge docs will be available soon. Learn more here.

Why it matters

Quickly after we launched Service Hub in May we started getting lots of feedback from more sophisticated teams around what they needed to implement Service Hub. In general they were looking for more flexibility and control. They needed a better solution for their more complex team structure, international growth, or more complex systems.

The new platform level enterprise features satisfied many of these needs in as do the addition of a few new dedicated enterprise products.

Service Hub Enterprise can be purchased as a standalone product or as part of the new HubSpot Growth Suite bundle.

What’s inside?

Service Hub:

Enterprise users will get everything that is part of Service Hub Professional today.

Enterprise platform features:

Service Hub Enterprise is built to grow with your team, as you expand and specialize. The new enterprise level features such as teams, custom bots, added reporting, and more make that easy.

- Learn more about the new enterprise features here.

In addition to the above, all of the platform capabilities, like teams, single sign-on, predictive lead scoring, custom events, custom property search, calculated roll-up properties, Slack integration, and more are also included in Marketing Hub Enterprise.

Service Hub Enterprise also features a number of new and coming features to help sophisticated teams.

Playbooks (now live)

These smart, built in, best practices, scripts, and more make it easy for your agents to access the best advice for customers in any given sitationation, even if they just joined the team.

Goals (coming soon)

Goals provides individual agents and teams the ability to report on metrics related to a specific personal goal. For example an agent can track their total avg. response time related to a company wide customer service level agreement.

Health Score (coming soon)

Health score is a number, specific to an individual contact, that helps services teams understand the risk (positive or negative) associate with keep that customer. You will set up a unique health score for your team, it can be determined on any criteria that you can also use for a list.

What languages is this available in?

All available languages

Sharing the news with customers

Service Hub Enterprise will be added to the HubSpot Service Hub pricing page by 5:00 pm on Sept 5th.

https://www.hubspot.com/pricing/growth-suite

Please let us know if you have any questions or feedback!

Source: External Blog Post, Product Notifications

What is it:

Now live is Service Hub Starter - a new entry level service package that helps early service teams build a basic help desk. This new package is made possible by adding a slimmed down version of tickets into the free tools. Tickets into free will rollout over the course of 2018.

Note: These tools are live now but won’t be publicly announced until later today - 5pm ET on Sept. 5th.

Why it matters

HubSpot is determined to help our customers experience value before they buy. With the addition of tickets to HubSpot’s free tools users can now experience using HubSpot for service for free.

Customers who purchase Service Hub Starter ($50 per user per month) can build a simple but powerful help desk with HubSpot branding removed and helpful productivity tools that make their process much more efficient.

User can click here to start using HubSpot free for service.

What’s inside?

Conversations:

With live chat, team email, and an easy-to-use chatbot builder, HubSpot gives you the messaging tools and context to have personalized conversations with prospects and customers at scale.

Tickets: Tickets, a new CRM object, offers a way to track, order, collaborate, and deliver on customers’ needs and expectations. The Ticket object can be associated with a contact, company, and deal within HubSpot, so all your teams will be able to see if a customer has an open issue.

Help Desk

Free and starter users can create an editable Support Form to capture service inquiries from their websites and turn them into tickets. These users will also be able to create custom Ticket properties and see basic reporting on tickets.

Productivity tools

Starter users will have the added benefit of HubSpot's productivity tools. They can use email Templates and Snippets to speed up responses to common customer questions. They can build email Sequences to save time and automate their process. They’ll be able to increase productivity and save time with the Meetings and Documents features. And all HubSpot branding will be removed from external service tools.

What languages is this available in?

All available languages

Sharing the news with customers

Service Hub Starter will be added to the HubSpot Service Hub pricing page by 5:00 pm on Sept 5th.

https://www.hubspot.com/pricing/service

Source: External Blog Post, Product Notfications

Entry Question: How does Service Hub differ from Sales Professional?
Response:
Service Hub shares the same individual user features as Sales Professional but the specific portal features is where the two packages differ.

 

Venn Diagram here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1JmwLXjViMAYgCGZBEHRM7K9ViecG82_N3uqqC_XG6sI/edit?usp=sharing

What is it:

Now live in HubSpot is Service Hub - a new product line from HubSpot 100% focused on a better customer experience.

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DwqJIPl9OnI&t=1s

 

Why it matters

Today, people are more skeptical and less trusting. They are less likely to care about your sales and marketing message and more likely to care what other customers think.

Read more about this change here.

 

With the addition of Service Hub, HubSpot now offers a full front office solution. Customers will have one view of the customer across sales, marketing, and service and have everything they need to go from funnel to flywheel.

 

Marketing is also changing - it's time for us to adapt.

 

How it works

Customers can find Service Hub under the Service drop down in the new nav. Service Hub is a new paid product line, learn more about the features here and pricing here.

 

What’s inside?

 

Conversations: (coming soon to the free CRM but currently live in Service Hub Pro)

The first tool you’ll see in Service Hub is conversations, a universal inbox that helps all teams collaborate on customer support at scale. Conversations can be the new home base for your whole team's communications; including customer conversations. It's built on the HubSpot CRM, so it’s rich with context about who you're talking to and what you know about them from a marketing, sales, and service standpoint.

 

Paid features:

 

Tickets: Tickets, a new CRM object, offers a way to track, order, collaborate, and deliver on customers’ needs and expectations. The ticket object can be associated with a contact, so all your teams will be able to see if a customer has an open issue. Tickets also come together to form a ticket board in Service Hub. The ticket board is a new home base for your support team.

 



Knowledge Base: Help customers help themselves

With the knowledge base, you can quickly create articles, make sure they rank on Google, and see valuable insights on a reporting dashboard that tells you how good a given article is at solving customers' issues and deflecting tickets.

 

 

Customer Feedback:

Customer feedback starts with a series of surveys, that you can use to routinely capture qualitative and quantitative feedback from your customers. This can be as simple as a yes-or-no question related to a support experience or a 20-question annual Net Promoter Score® (NPS) survey. With data flowing in on customer happiness you’ll also start to figure out who your biggest promoters are. Use that information to build customer marketing campaigns that help these customers tell the world about your product or service.

 



 

Service Hub Reporting Dashboard:

Service Hub comes with a dedicated reporting dashboard. You’ll be able to measure and monitor ticket data, customer happiness, knowledge article results and much more.

 

Ticket Automation and help desk.

Service Hub is features rich automation platform capabilities. You’ll be able to automate ticket creation and build a help that can help customers get answers.

 

What languages is this available in?

All available languages

 

Available in internal portals?

Portal 53 and Biglytics have access to Service Hub - please use Biglictics for all demo purposes.

 

Sharing the news with customers

 

HubSpot user blog with product details

 

Help us promote the launch and make sure your customers get a demo of the new tools.

 

So, share the news and share it creatively, and you might win $5,000. Visit this wiki page to share it easily across all your networks, or customize one of the samples below.

 

Now live in HubSpot - Service Hub - A new product line 100% focused on a better customer experience. It’s time to succeed because your customers did. https://youtu.be/DwqJIPl9OnI #ServiceHub

 

Today, customers have the biggest impact on growth. It’s time to stop treating customers like an output and embrace a customer driven approach to growth. https://youtu.be/KCUHv8n8YCs #ServiceHub


Source: Product Notifications

Export Tickets You and your customer service team work through a lot of tickets, which means you have a lot of data. With today’s beta, you have the power to control your data by exporting your tickets into a file type of your choice (CSV, XLS, XLSX).

How does it work?

Within tickets, look at the left-hand menu and click “Options” and “Export”.

Then, select the file format and which ticket properties you want to include and hit the “Export” button.

When your export it ready you will get an email from HubSpot containing a link to download your file.

Languages? Available in all languages supported by HubSpot.

Source: Product Notifications

I'm currently working with the forms team to see if we can go through and swap it out for existing forms that are using the contact file upload property, but in the meantime, users can swap it out themselves and the attachment will go to the ticket.

Customers want to feel heard when they have problems, and more importantly they want to know that their issues are being actively worked on by you and your customer service team. With this beta, you can now send an automatic email notification for the opening and closing of each ticket. This makes it easy to keep customers up-to-date on the status of their ticket and saves your precious time.

How does it work?

When you open or close a ticket, an email will be automatically sent to the customer associated with the ticket:

Languages? This beta feature is currently available in English only, but there are plans to expand language offerings in the future.

Entry Question: Import Tickets and Products to Your CRM with a Refreshed UI
Response:
What is it?
Rolling out soon are a refreshed imports UI and the ability to import tickets and products to your HubSpot CRM.

Why does it matter?
No one likes manual data entry - so it’s important that your HubSpot CRM import process runs as smoothly and efficiently as possible. The new import UI does just that.

 

New to Service Hub Professional or Sales Hub Professional? Bulk importing of tickets and products will save you a ton of time and stress. An easy import process means more accurate data within your HubSpot CRM in less time than manual data entry. Less time spent on data entry means more time and resources spent building meaningful relationships with your customers.


How does it work?
Perform an import as you would before by visiting the contacts, companies, deals, products, or tickets page. Then, select a file (XLS, XLSX, or CSV) and upload your objects:

 

 

The new, more visual import mapping screen provides you with a better experience when importing your data:

 

 

Note: The new imports UI no longer supports the ability to set a lifecycle stage upon import. All new contacts will automatically be set as subscribers if they have not already been set otherwise. If you want to assign a lifecycle stage upon import, simply add a column with lifecycle stages within the file you are importing. Additionally, the ability to add contacts to Static Lists via import has been temporarily disabled and will be added back shortly.

 

Who gets it?
These updates are on a progressive rollout. Once fully live the new imports UI will be available to all customers and the ability to import tickets and products will be available to Service Hub Professional and Sales Hub Professional users, respectively.

This update is now live to all new portals created on/after today, June 27th. For more background information and details on the rollout plan for new imports, check out and follow this wiki page.


Languages?
Available in all languages supported by HubSpot.

 

Source: Product Notifications

What is it?

A new feedback mechanism and insights that tell users how helpful their customers find a given knowledge base article.

Why does it matter? Making sure your articles are sufficiently solving your customers problems is essential in delivering effective self help to your customers. Allowing your customers to indicate if they found an article helpful will highlight the articles that are in need of an update.

How does it work?

  • Each knowledge article now contains a feedback section with a yes or no button that allows customers to indicate whether they found the article helpful or not.

  • Each Yes/No click is tracked and reported upon in the article insights screen

  • Every article feedback is also tracked on the contact timeline

Who gets it? Available to all Service Hub Professional users.

Is this available in Biglytics?

Yes, live example here

Languages? All languages supported by HubSpot

Source: Product Notifications

1) Appearance is now at an *inbox* level (so chat widgets for distinct inboxes can be styled differently)

2) The “send from” feature that powered the avatar and name shown in the widget before assignment has been updated to a label “Chat Heading” - we’ve also updated this feature to let users add a “custom” avatar and name to support more generic use cases/brands

3) The end of the experience will facilitate COS sites and non COS sites differently

4) When we can’t detect chat scripts loading anywhere, we surface this state to users within inbox

5) Settings for live chat are cleaner/nested under tabs and somewhat easier to understand

6) We added the ability to disable Chat transcripts from sending automatically.

What is it?

New analytics that show users what your customers are searching for in your knowledge base.

Reply to Graham and Marcus with your customer’s HubID to request beta access. Why does it matter? A great way to make sure your knowledge base actually helps your customers and answers their questions is to analyze the terms that are most frequently searched for. If you don’t have an article for a high frequency search term, it’s a good idea to build one for it.

How does it work?

  • In the Knowledge Base insights screen, scroll down to the search reports section.

  • For the time period selected you can see:

    • How many searches have been carried out by your customers

    • The search terms that do not return any results

    • The search terms that are effectively delivering answers to your customers

Who gets it? This open beta is available to all Service Hub Professional users whose CSM request access. Languages? All languages supported by HubSpot

Source: Product Notifications

What is it?

The ability for users to control the order in which articles and categories appear on the homepage and category pages in their knowledge base.

Reply to Graham and Marcus with your customer's HubID to request access.

Why does it matter? Some knowledge articles are more important than others. To deliver an effective knowledge base to your customers, it's important to increase the visibility of articles that relate to the most frequently asked questions. Until now, categories and articles were ordered alphabetically. With this update users are in complete control of how their articles and categories are ordered.

How does it work?

  • In the Knowledge Base articles screen, click “Organize categories”.

  • Simply drag and drop an article, subcategory and category to a new position and the knowledge base will be updated.

Who gets it? This is an open beta, available for all Service Hub Professional users who's CSM requests access.Languages? All languages supported by HubSpot

What is it?

Now in beta in the feedback tool, is new automation that allows you set up actions that are triggered by a contacts response to a NPS survey.

This new prescriptive step makes it easier for users to start to implement flywheel type tactics, such as emailing net promoters automatically with a link to submit a positive review.

Reply to Cambria and Marcus with your customers Hub ID to request beta access.

Why it matters

The data you gather from customer feedback is essential for growth. Whether it’s feedback on your product, business, or own personal work, insights from how your customers think and feel will immediately help you make better decisions.

The secret to getting the most out of this valuable data is to put it to work as soon as possible. Taking action on feedback isn’t something most businesses do. By embedding automated actions right into the feedback process we’ll help guide you on what actions make the most sense, and help you to turn that feedback into actions that lead directly to growth.

Examples of what’s possible with NPS feedback automation:

  • Automatically emails net promoters encouraging them to write a review, testimonials, or join a referral program.

  • Automatically email net detractors who didn’t provide comments on their rating. This helps you dig deeper into their issue and learn more.

  • Create tasks or tickets for your team to follow up with customers based on their specific feedback.

  • Create slack notifications to share feedback more easily with your entire org.

How it works

You can find these automation options when creating or editing a customer loyalty survey. They do not live in workflows, you can only find them in this section of feedback for now.

Who gets it

This feature is currently available to a beta group of Service Hub Professional customers. Reply to this email to request access.

What languages is this available in?

Available in all languages supported by HubSpot.

Available in internal portals?

Available in Biglytics

Source: Product Notifications

Entry Question: Customer Experience Survey Web Delivery in Feedback
Response:
What is it?

Service Hub customers can now deliver surveys to their website visitors via their website. These customer experience surveys are a new option in the feedback tool in Service Hub.

To request access respond to Cambria/Marcus with the Hub ID you want ungated.

Why it matters

The first step in becoming a more customer driven, flywheel type business, is to engage with more customers more often. Customer feedback, via email, live chat, in-person, and survey is critical to understand what your customers think about your product or service and why.

The ability to deliver customer experience surveys in-context for customers as they navigate your website can provide a totally new insights. This feedback comes from users (known contacts) while they are experiencing your site and the insights we’ve seen customers gather from it are unlike other types.

Maybe you’ll collect feedback on a post-checkout experience and learn why a person didn’t buy. Maybe you’ll gather feedback from a happy user on a new feature you just launched and learn why they get so much value. Maybe you’ll better understand the quality of a page on your website, in the moment when your customer is experiencing it.

How it works

You can find this new delivery option when creating or editing a Customer Experience survey:

Who gets it

This feature is currently available to a beta group of Service Hub Professional customers. To request access respond to Cambria with the Hub ID you want ungated.

What languages is this available in?

Available in all languages supported by HubSpot.

Available in internal portals?

Available in Biglytics

Sharing the news with customers

Please let us know if you have any customers who would like beta access to this new feature!

Entry Question: Service Hub. Feedback: Flexibility & Customization Updates
Response:
What is it?

A number of feedback updates that make the product more flexible and customizable.

  • The ability to trigger surveys on deal, ticket, and company properties, not just contact properties.

  • Enhanced customization across surveys. You can now fully customize the from name, from address, subject line, and greeting across your surveys.

With today’s update to support triggering surveys across deal, ticket, and company properties, you can now collect customer feedback after your prospects complete the sales process, onboarding, and any meaningful touchpoint customers have with your business. You can also now deploy one-off NPS surveys to collect feedback on a recurring or a one-off basis from your customers. Finally, with customizable from names, from addresses, subject lines, and greetings, you can personalize your feedback to improve response rates across your surveys.  

How it works:

You can find these customization and triggering options when creating or editing a survey:

Entry Question: How does the Customer Experience Surveys work?
Response:
What is it?

Customer experience surveys are now live inside of Feedback, a tool inside of Service Hub. CX surveys are transactional surveys that help teams understand the satisfaction of their customers at a particular moment in time.

^ Quick product overview loom.

Why it matters

Asking people a simple question survey right after a specific interaction is a great to capture feedback. The experience is fresh in their minds and they are more likely to respond if it all feel like part of the same interaction. For example, CX surveys can be presented right after a sales call, after a customer completes onboarding, after a customer attends an event, or after specific marketing material is provided to a client.

With customer experience surveys, you’ll have everything you need to understand what customers think of your product or service (through customer loyalty surveys), your customer support (through customer support surveys), and specific points in the customer journey (through the newly introduced customer experience surveys).

How it works

CX surveys are a new option when building a survey in the Customer Feedback tool - click here to access in your portal.

Who gets it

All customers who have Service Hub Professional.

What languages is this available in?

All HubSpot-supported languages

Available in internal portals?

Available in Biglytics

External Blog Post

What is it?

This update allows users to view the Conversations that site visitors are having with bots.

Why does it matter?

Building a bot can be tricky. You want to make sure it’s working and that folks are engaging with the chatbot in the way that you’ve anticipated. Now, users can have visibility into the conversations that their site visitors are having with their bots.  They can watch a conversation happen in real-time, and even take over the conversation when needed.

How does it work?

When site visitors have a conversation with a bot, that conversation will appear under the Bots section of the Conversations inbox:

Users will have the option to manually jump in and reassign the conversation at any point.

Who gets it?

This update is now live to all HubSpot users.

Source: Prod Notifications

Entry Question: Bots are now available in Sales Hub Starter and Sales Hub Professional
Response:
What is it?


 

Bots are now available in Sales Hub Starter and Sales Hub Professional. Sales Hub users can deploy lead qualifying bots or meeting booking bots via messages.


***It’s important to note that Sales Hub users MUST opt-in to the new nav in order to get access to bots.***


Why does it matter?


Implementing a live chat strategy can be a big undertaking for teams; especially as they work to balance bandwidth and establish a clear process for responding to incoming chats. That’s where chatbots come in.


Chatbots help teams have conversations at scale. Use bots to replace your most monotonous exchanges (like qualifying leads or finding time to book meetings) and keep your team focused on the conversations that matter most.


How does it work?


To create a bot, navigate to Conversations and select Bots from the dropdown.



Click Create bot, choose the type of bot you’d like to build, and give it a name.



Next, you’ll be able to customize the flow of the conversation. Add messages, tweak lines of copy, collect contact info and more.

 



Once you’re finished customizing your bot, toggle it on. You’ll be able to choose the message that you’d like to associate that bot with.


​



Who gets it? (Pay close attention as this might get a bit complicated. :))


Bots are now available to all Sales Hub Starter and Sales Hub Professional users who have opted into the new nav. They are able to use bots via messages (our legacy live chat feature).


Bots are also available as a feature in conversations. Who has access to conversations?

  1. Service Hub Professional Users

  2. All new portals created after 5/10 with Sales Hub Starter or Sales Hub Professional

 
(On 6/12, all Sales Hub Users will officially have access to conversations. The messages functionality that they are familiar with today will appear as "chat" -- a channel of conversations.)

 

Source: Product Notification

Entry Question: Does the Chat feature comply with the new GDPR regulations?
Response:
With the upcoming launch of GDPR, prospects from the EU have been asking whether we'll have an opt-in method for the chat feature in Hubspot. I reached out to the appropriate people in product and found that this is IN THE WORKS. 

Under GDPR, We need to prompt users for consent before starting conversations. Here is what that experience might look like. 

Live Chat

  • User will be able to enable or disable 'consent to contact' at a portal level
  • User will be provided with a standard disclosure that they can edit.

Anonymous visitor interaction

  • Visitor opens widget
  • Visitor is shown a consent prompt
  • Visitor gives consent -> contact property is updated -> conversation can start
  • Visitor does not give consent -> conversation cannot start

Agent

  • Show inline message letting them know when a visitor has declined
  • Show tooltip on hover with further explanation

Email

  • Unknown at this time

Facebook

  • Unknown at this time

Here is a mockup of what they are proposing for a design and experience. 

 

Source: Slack Conversation with Hannah Roberts (Product Expert)

Question: If one opts out of all emails, do they opt out of Customer Feedback emails as well?

Answer: Customer Feedback emails are sent from noreply which is attached to the portal the customer is opting out from. This means they will not receive Customer Feedback emails.

These are considered marketing emails.

Slack Convo: https://hubspot.slack.com/archives/CA83NTXQB/p1526388897000377

Product team are exploring this at the moment but we do not have a timeline for it.
We now have the ability to create surveys in different languages but the moment, it is only in one language.
So you can create a survey in German or English but not both.
Source: Slack

Entry Question: Typing Indicators & Read Receipts for Live Chat
Response:
What is it?

Live chat conversations now include typing indicators and read receipts.

Why does it matter?

A text-based online chat is just like an in person conversation… if you strip away all the visual, audio, and social cues! Those cues need digital replacements.

A few examples:

  • In a phone conversation, it’s easy to tell when someone is talking because you can hear them. With live chat, typing indicators help fill that void and ensure that folks aren’t interrupting or “talking over” one another.

  • When you’re speaking to someone in person, You can literally see that they are present and attentive. Sound (yup, mmhmm, even background noise) help solve for this when you’re chatting over the phone, and read receipts help fill this void for talking over live chat.

By bringing typing indicators and read receipts to Conversations, we’re allowing reps to have more natural, fluid conversations with prospects and customers at scale.

How does it work?

Typing indicators will appear for both the rep and the site visitor whenever the person on the other end is typing a response:

Read receipts will appear for reps as a mechanism for understanding whether or not a site visitor has seen their response. Read receipts will appear when the site visitor has the browser tab containing the widget in the foreground, and the widget open in that tab.

It’s important to note that site visitors will NOT see read receipts.

Who gets it?

This update is now live to all users.

Source: Product Notifications

What is it?

The latest update makes it easy for reps to view and manage deals directly from the conversations inbox with the addition of a deal card:

Why does it matter?

Conversations helps reps connect with prospects and customers the moment they’re most engaged; but the real power of Conversations comes from the way it’s built on top of HubSpot. Not only can reps connect with prospects and customers, they can also follow up on those conversations and GSD without skipping a beat. The addition of the Deals card is just one of the small ways we’re helping teams work more efficiently.

How does it work?

Simply select a conversation and scroll down the contact sidebar to view deal information and/or create a new deal:

Who gets it?

The deal card in Conversations is now live and available to all users.

Source: Product Notifications

What is it?

If your shared inbox (ie: info@yourcompany.com) is not hosted by Office 365 or Google, you can now set up a hosted email in HubSpot and forward emails from your mail client to your hosted email in the Conversations inbox.

With this update Conversations now supports Google Groups and email aliases, too.

Why does it matter?

Conversations gives teams the transparency and tools they need to manage email inquiries, but previously, only inboxes hosted via Office 365 or Google could be connected to Conversations. The latest update offers even more flexibility for teams who are not using Office 365 or Google hosted email inboxes to make use of Conversations.

How does it work?

Select “Google Group” to connect a Google Group account or select “Choose a different provider” to connect all other email clients.

On the next screen, enter a from name and a hosted email address. If you’re a paid user, your hosted address will be [your username]@[your subdomain].hs-inbox.com; if you’re a free user it will be [your username]@[your subdomain].hubspot.inbox.com. It’s important to note that once you configure your hosted email address, it cannot be edited.

Next, you’ll be able to set your send from address. This could be the same as your forwarding address (ie: [your username]@[your subdomain].hs-inbox.com), or it could be a custom address (ie: info@yourcompany.com).

Lastly, you’ll need to add your hosted email address as a forwarding address in your mail client settings.

The full knowledge doc on how to do this is available here.

Who gets it?

This update is now live to all HubSpot users.

Source: Prod Notifications

What is it?

The latest update gives teams three options for managing their chat availability:

 

Why does it matter?

Different teams have different needs when it comes to managing chats. Small teams or solopreneurs may want to be always available; giving them optimal opportunity to connect with site visitors. Larger teams or those with limited bandwidth require a bit more control to ensure that incoming chats don’t fall through the cracks. The latest update allows teams to choose the setting that works best for them.

 

How does it work?

From the Conversations inbox, select Inbox Settings in the bottom left hand corner and choose Chat. From there, you’ll be able to edit your chat availability settings:

 

Here’s a breakdown of how these work:

  • Always On: Your live chat widget will always display your team as being available to chat.
  • Based on team member status: Your live chat widget will display your team as being available to chat as long as there is at least one user who has set themselves as available. If you choose this option, you’ll also have the ability to set an away message.
  • During business hours: Your live chat widget will display your team as being available to chat during business hours as long as there is at least one user who has set themselves as available If you choose this option, you’ll have the ability to set an away message that will appear during business hours if all users are “away”. You’ll also have the option to customize the message that appears outside of business hours (you can even choose to hide the widget entirely).

 

Who gets it?

This update is now live to all Service Hub and Sales Hub users.

 

 

Source: Product Notifications

Entry Question: If an unknown person emails support, are they added as a contact? If so, what is their lifecycle stage? What is their original source?
Response:
LC Stage = Subscriber
Original Source = Offline
Original Source 1 = CONVERSATIONS
Original Source 2 = AddMessageUser
 
Sources: tested in own portal

Entry Question: If an unknown person starts a chat, are they added as a contact? If so, what is their lifecycle stage? What is their original source?
Response:
Yes they are!

 

LC Stage = Empty
Original Source = Offline
Original Source 1 = BOT
Original Source 2 = 3140

 

Sources: tested in own portal
